-C.value: try { Use-Icinga -Minimal; } catch { Write-Output 'The Icinga PowerShell Framework is either not installed on the system or not configured properly. Please check https://icinga.com/docs/windows for further details'; Write-Output 'Error:' $$($$_.Exception.Message)Components:`r`n$$( Get-Module -ListAvailable 'icinga-powershell-*' )`r`n'Module-Path:'`r`n$$($$Env:PSModulePath); exit 3; }; Exit-IcingaExecutePlugin -Command '$ifw_api_command$'

-ThresholdInterval.set_if: var str = macro("$IcingaCheckUpdates_String_ThresholdInterval$"); if (len(str) == 0) { return false; }; return true;

16.description:
Checks if there is a pending reboot on the system to finalize Windows Updates and returns
warning if one is pending
16.caption: WarnOnReboot

7.description: The critical threshold for the total pending update count on the Windows machine
7.caption: Critical

5.description:
Allows to filter for names of updates being included in the total update count, allowing a specific monitoring and filtering of certain updates
beyond the provided categories
5.caption: UpdateFilter

18.description: Disables the performance data output of this plugin
18.caption: NoPerfData

12.description: The warning threshold for the Microsoft Defender update count on the Windows machine
12.caption: WarningDefender

10.description: The warning threshold for the rollup update count on the Windows machine
10.caption: WarningRollups

2.description: Defines with which Execution Policy the PowerShell is started
2.caption: PowerShell Execution Policy

8.description: The warning threshold for the security update count on the Windows machine
8.caption: WarningSecurity

17.description:
Checks if there is a pending reboot on the system to finalize Windows Updates and returns
critical if one is pending
17.caption: CritOnReboot

11.description: The critical threshold for the rollup update count on the Windows machine
11.caption: CriticalRollups

9.description: The critical threshold for the security update count on the Windows machine
9.caption: CriticalSecurity

14.description: The warning threshold for all other updates on the Windows machine
14.caption: WarningOther

15.description: The critical threshold for all other updates on the Windows machine
15.caption: CriticalOther

6.description: The warning threshold for the total pending update count on the Windows machine
6.caption: Warning

4.description: Change the value your defined threshold checks against from the current value to a collected time threshold of the Icinga for Windows daemon, as described here: https://icinga.com/docs/icinga-for-windows/latest/doc/110-Installation/06-Collect-Metrics-over-Time/ An example for this argument would be 1m or 15m which will use the average of 1m or 15m for monitoring.
4.caption: ThresholdInterval

19.description:
Changes the behavior of the plugin output which check states are printed:
0 (default): Only service checks/packages with state not OK will be printed
1: Only services with not OK will be printed including OK checks of affected check packages including Package config
2: Everything will be printed regardless of the check state
3: Identical to Verbose 2, but prints in addition the check package configuration e.g (All must be [OK])
19.caption: Verbosity

13.description: The critical threshold for the Microsoft Defender update count on the Windows machine
13.caption: CriticalDefender
